chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Guiden Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travis Guiden Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Travis Guiden Jr was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Injury [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Travis Guiden Jr was found guilty of Hit and Run [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Travis Guiden Jr was found guilty of Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Travis Guiden Jr was found guilty of Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: COUNTS 1, 3, 4, AND 6: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge. Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Pay $35.00 to the Milwaukee County District Attorney's office and $500.00 to Oloya G.
Concurrent with: Count 1; credit for 211 days time served.
Consecutive to: Count 3; credit for 0 days time served.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (34 pages) commencing 10-04-2016 received and filed. CH
Associated with Charge #4
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Travis Guiden in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Travis Guiden in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Terri M.
AS to count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 211 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 
AS to count 3:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, concurrent with count 1, credit for 211 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 
AS to count 4:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 3, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS
AS to count 6:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 4 with credit for 0 days time served.  

-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
-Pay stipulated restitution (as to count 3)  in the amount of $35.00 to the Milwaukee County District Attorney's office and $500.00 to Oloya G.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Travis Guiden not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to jury trial in progress and defense counsel needing to obtain pretrial credit information the court will adjourn sentencing to 10-4-2016 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

AS to counts 1,3,4, and 6:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 9-29-2016 at 8:15am

Defendant Travis Guiden in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Travis Guiden in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is set for trial today however the parties have reached a resolution.  Amended Information filed by the state omitting counts 2 and 5 as count 2 will be dismissed and read in and count 5 is dismissed outright.  AS to count 1 the repeater statute is corrected to 939.62(1)(a); AS to count 4 the repeater enhancer is deleted; AS to count 6 charge is amended to RESISTING an Officer Habitual Criminality Repeater, a class A misdemeanor contrary to 946.41(1) and 939.62(1)(a).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Atty Toran contacted the court and requested a bail review.  ADA Karshen was still present and agreed to 9-9-2016 at 8:15.

Defendant Travis Guiden in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Travis Guiden in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

DAUBERT HEARING PROCEEDED.  Sworn for the State:  Detective Lynda Stott on direct examination.  Cross examination.  Redirect examination.  Recross examination.  Court heard arguments from both parties.  Court finds the witness to be qualified in giving expert testimony and will allow the witness to testify as to relevant testimony.

FINAL PRETRIAL PROCEEDED.  State concluded 4 relevant convictions for the defenant.  STate in the process of serving witnesses.  Trial to last 4-5 days.  No statement from the defendant.  No Other Acts evidence or Character evidence.  No unusual Motion In Limine.  Possible resolution.  Negotiations remain open.  Defense makes a open record request for any videos State may have.
